headline: Oven-Baked Garlic and Parmesan Fries
description: Homemade garlic Parmesan fries are made with russet potatoes tossed with thyme and parsley and baked in the oven until crisp, cheesy, and delicious.
name: Oven-Baked Garlic and Parmesan Fries
recipeIngredient: 4 large unpeeled russet potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch strips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Place potatoes in a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Season with garlic, thyme, and 1/4 teaspoon seasoned salt; toss until are evenly coated. Lift fries out of the bowl and spread evenly onto a nonstick baking sheet. Save remaining oil in the bowl.

Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, flipping fries halfway. Return fries to the bowl with olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and parsley; toss to coat. Spread again onto the baking sheet.
Continue baking until cheese melts, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese and 1/4 teaspoon seasoned salt to serve.

review.reviewBody: These were the best oven fries I have ever made - before the addition of the parmesan and the extra baking at the end. They were still really good, and the extra flavor was fun. So try them both ways! Perfect directions for plain oven baked fries if you stop after 30 minutes. A nice flavor twist if you want to add the parmesan. I did bake mine for slightly less time both before and after adding the parm, but I had sliced them fairly thin.

This recipe is incredible. There's nothing wrong with experimenting with your own seasonings, but why? As written, this is perfect. I used foil to make clean up easier, but some of the fries stuck to the foil. Either it was the store brand foil I used or maybe parchment paper would work better. Doubling this recipe yields about a cookie sheet of fries. And if you don't double it, you will regret it, because they fries are so delicious. Be sure to spread the fries out. If they are crowded, it will be less likely that they will get brown and crispy.
These are amazing. I ate so many you can just call me Miss Piggy
definitely a keeper
I didn't make any changes to the recipe. Loved them!
Secret to this recipe is use Duck Fat instead if oil! You will be blown away
They were good. Next I will add different spices
Very yummy
Absolutely delicious and my family loved them! I am making them again tonight.
This turned out so well! I used twice the potatoes and half the oil and the same amount of cheese and it turned out great. I'll definitely make it again.

Loved these fries with and without the Parmesan cheese!
Really enjoyed these fries!
I didnt make any changes. But next time I wilil cut the temp to 400° instead. Over all they turned out pretty good!!
Just made these! Super delicious but mine didn’t turn out very crispy. Still, it’s very tasty! I don’t think I added enough cheese :P
Easy, delicious, kids loved them with our grilled spicy andouille sausage.
Not your ordinary fries! My family destroyed these. I will be making them again.

I had a craving for garlic-parm fries, but due to all the kids being sick with a cold, haven't been to the store in 2 weeks so my pantry was slim and I didn't have all the ingredients on hand. I had to sub garlic powder and dried parsley for the fresh and I only had grated Romano cheese, no parm. Otherwise, I followed this as written. Even though I had to improvise a few of the ingredients, these came out tasting superb. I can't wait to make them again once I do have everything called for.
These were delicious, however, not good to make for large group. Will make again for 4 no more.

Usually I need more garlic, but this recipe doesn't need 3 cloves. Next time I will try powdered garlic. The last ten minutes were unneeded. It does need the powdered parm during the bake time, but you could use shredded to melt at the end.
Omg bet you can't eat just one!
You really don't need so much salt, the cheese had enough.. but great otherwise
Super easy. Incredibly delicious. The whole cul de sac was drooling over the amazing aromas coming from my oven. A keeper
love it!
Easy and delicious! They're perfect for when I want a healthier alternative to fast food fries.
This was the best potato dish ever!!! I crave them every day. Be warned: you should double, or triple this recipe.
no and i love it
These were delicious!!!
Excellent will be making this again soon.
Very yummy recipe. Will make again!
I didn't add parmesan and I used about 6 golden potatoes and they are still amazing
Easy, and delicious!
The family loved it.
Turned out great! Used only half the amount of the Parmesan cheese to cut down on the sodium.
everyone loved these, will definitely make again and again! followed recipe exactly they were perfect

I made this with dinner, turned out really good! My wife couldn't stop eating them! I followed the recipe exactly although it seemed as though they weren't getting done in the amount of time stated so I just turned on the broiler for a few minutes at the end. I will definitely be making these again.
I used red skin potatoes only because that is what I had. I also threw in the rest of shredded pharm that I had left over along with the grated and my husband raved over these!
the Parmesan cheese is salty with the seasoned salt was a little bit too salty
Soooo yummy! Had to use Romano cheese mistress-delicious!
Loved making these!
They were pretty good however I added more seasoning salt for flavor and put the oven on broil afterwards so I could make them crisper.
Made as per recipe but had no Parmesan cheese, very good, will make again!
used a mandolin to make thick shoestrings, but still too thin. Next time will cut by hand. Nice and crispy.

These are by far the very best oven fries I've ever had!!!! I would even go so far as to say I like them better than regular french fries. Once you eat one, you're hooked. My picky great granddaughter even loves them so that's saying a lot.
They turned out great.
Goes with a lot of meals. Kids will ty and ask for more.
Words can't do just justice, this was a very impressive dish. No need for tweaking recipe, the flavor was perfect. Everybody who ate it wanted more.
These are really close to the garlic cheese fries we get at the stadium. The only thing I added was more garlic (our family loves garlic). Great recipe, thanks for sharing.
The potatoes stuck horribly to the pan. The flavor was bland.
I had to Dr. it up and kinda do my thing but it was okay.
Oh yeah, oh yeah, oh yeah, oh yeah...
I skipped the Parmesan cheese and this recipe was delicious even without it! I checked the fries halfway through cooking and decided to bump the oven temp up to 450, finished them perfectly.
Excellent side dish. Great flavor.
Baked longer than the recipe stated, but I could not get the fries done. We all tried them anyway, and none of us liked them. Surprisingly, they had no flavor.

Good recipe! I didn't have seasoned salt so I used Himalayan pink salt turned out great! Also only had organic potatoes which are half the size of GMO potatoes, so used 2 organic in place of one regular. Nice and garlicky yum!

These were good, my husband enjoyed them. I made exactly as written with four russet potatoes, except I substituted dried parsley for fresh. I thought they were still somewhat mushy though. Next time I will try turning on the broiler for a few minutes at the end of cooking.
This was great thanks!!!
Tastes very nice!

These were great!!!!! I made just as the recipe called for (except not exact measurements b/c I cook/ bake off hand) AND THESE WERE AMAZING HUBBY COULDN'T GET ENOUGH. By the time dinner was ready, I had to cook a whole new batch of fries b/c he snuck in the kitchen and ate them all.

Will Definitely be making these again!

I made these fries tonight...because I was craving fries and didn't want to go out in the snow. I made them a little different...i had to use what I had. I seasoned with garlic, onion, and sea salt. I cooked them for 30 min. then added more olive oil, cheese, and salt...then I cooked for another 10 min. these fries were delicious!!!! I'm so glad I found this recipe. I will be making again.
This is excellent. I added truffle oil also. 1/4 cup (25% truffle oil and 75% olive oil). Came out great!

The flavor was mundane, and the fries came out soggy mush. I could modify this recipe to make it work though. To fix this, first i would deep fry them. When done I would sprinkle garlic POWDER on them, then the other ingredients, minus the oil.

Before I ate them I thought they smelled incredible, but when I tasted them, they were amazing. I had them with a hamburger and that was a good combination. But don't use catsup. That would drown out the flavor.
Awesome. Everyone loved these. Made for cookout with friends and got lots of complements!
Tastes great! I added a little sea salt at the end.
I added some Cajun and creole seasoning and these were to die for!
Perfect texture and robust flavor with the minced garlic. Subbed rosemary for the parsley, and omitted the parmesan since we are eating Whole30 style lately.... great side with our brisket!
These were wonderful! I had my old oven at 400 and they were done in 30 minutes. I can't stop eating them. Thanks for the recipe!

Amazing fries! I used Garlic Powder and they still came out great. Only change I made was I used the Broiler a little to Brown the fries in the end and to help melt the cheese a little faster. I will make these again soon. Suggest a french fry cutter because you are going to want to make extra!
These were simply fabulous. Will definitely make again and again.
Delicious fries. I changed it up a bit and used red potatoes, a little less carbs & starch.
The fries stuck to the cookie sheet so bad that they were like mashed potatoes. My family inhaled them within 5 minutes so yes they are good.

Served these to a group of friends this weekend and everyone loved them. Followed the basic recipe with a few changes because of what I had on hand. Used garlic powder, dried parsley, and jarred Parmesan cheese instead of fresh products...it was quicker and the taste was still really good.

Did not have a non-stick sheet pan, lined one with a Silpat and the other with parchment paper. Parchment is the quicker way to go...no clean up.

The main change I made was to NOT return the fries to the bowl and the olive oil after 15 min. They still had plenty of oil and were browning nicely. 

I also changed the cooking time/order a bit out of necessity. I wanted the potatoes to be ready when the burgers came off the grill. So I pulled the pans after the 30 min cook and sat them aside. Then just before I was ready to serve them I sprinkled with the seasoned salt and parmesan and put them back in the hot oven for the last 10 min.
The trick to crispy fries - after you cut them, dry them individually with a tea towel befor putting them in the bowl and adding the oil. More oil will stick and they will be less soggy!
Best garlic fries ever and highly addictive...lol.
I tried to flip them and they all broke and ended up being mushy! :(
The spices and garlic didn't add much flavor to the fries. They were browned but that is not the same as being crisp.
Delicious wow!!!!!!!!!!!
Homely and addictive indeed!
So delicious! I've used practically every kind of potato to make these. They are awesome whatever the style of potato you slice up!
Fantastic!! Crowd pleaser. And I'm around some picky people..

My fries had good flavor, but they were soooo greasy. The flipping and reseasoning and cooking some more was annoying; and an hour to produce these fries makes them impractical during the work/school week. I will keep looking, but thank you for sharing!
The flavor was delicious, but 30 minutes at 425 F burned the fries and the garlic!

I used 1 large russet potato and cut it into rounds. After cutting the potato, I put the potato in cold water and let it sit for 15 minutes. After the 15 minutes, I dried the potatoes thoroughly. I then mixed 1/4 cup of olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt and 2 cloves of garlic. I followed the recipe as written for the rest, except I only used 2 tbs of parmasean and 1/4 tsp of salt for the final step.
These were ok. I followed the recipe exactly, but they were greasy for my taste.
I was out of Parmesan, and these were great even without it. I cut my fries very thin, and they only took about 25 minutes to cook. My husband said these are his new favorite potato side dish.

Make sure to soak the potatoes in salted water for an hour or so for a crispier potato. Soaking allows some of the starches leech out into the water. The starch in potatoes hinders moisture from escaping, which leaves more water in the potato. Make sure to rinse the potatoes well after soaking (to remove the starch) and pat them completely dry before cooking.
Nothing not to like about these fries, they were great. Mine were perfectly cooked at 40 minutes.
These are Great!!! Even my picky eaters loved them and they were really easy to make.
A solid five. These are very good and easy to make.
love it

I heated the sheet pan while preheating the oven then sprayed with Misto before adding potatoes. Cut rounds for ease of flipping. Out of thyme so skipped. Pecorino instead and garlic powder instead. Dd approved which means I'll be making again soon.
good

Excellent! These were loved by all. My kids love anything with Parmesan cheese. I waited until the very end to add the seasoning and cheese mixture, cuz I was afraid it would burn cooking it for over 30 minutes. Mine took a little longer to cook (about 40-45 min). I also used parchment paper so they could not stick to the pan. Then once the fries were good and crispy, I added the cheese and seasoning mixture, and cooked about another 7-8 minutes. They were perfect.

My goodness! These are soo GREAT!
My family loves this very much.Yummy yummy yummy YUM!
Make sure it gets its crispiness!! :)
These were fantastic! I didn't find the method to be too overly time consuming. I used russet and sweet potatoes...the sweet potatoes were the best I've had from the oven. Really good!!

These fries are awesome! I made a combo of yellow, red, and sweet potatoes and the whole family just loved them. It has quickly become a regular side dish in our house. Please note... if you use sweet potato, place them on a separate baking sheet because they tend to cook faster than the regular potatoes. I also added a little garlic powder since I was out of fresh garlic. De-lish!

Yummy! Will use less oil next time. I added Old Bay seasoning to the parm both times. Gave it that little extra something. Forgot to turn the fries during cooking and it didn't matter. I'll probably make these at least once a week from now on.
Delicious!

I don't know what I did wrong here, but they turned out mushy and greasy, and I followed the recipe pretty closely. The overall flavor was wonderful, but I think if I made these again, I'd use less oil and less cheese (or more potatoes), cut the potatoes into larger wedges and bake longer, and DEFINITELY use parchment paper when baking.
My daughter loves these! These are also healthier since there are no preservatives :)
